newsitem.title: UK: Malaysia 96/97 cocoa crop seen higher at 130,000 Tonnes.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia 96/97 cocoa crop seen higher at 130,000 Tonnes.

text.p: Malaysia is expecting its 1996/97 (Oct-Sept) cocoa crop to reach 130,000 tonnes from an estimated 126,000 tonnes in the previous season, a government official said on Thursday. "There is going to be a modest recovery in the production of cocoa in Malaysia," the official, who did not want to be named, told Reuters on the sidelines of the International Cocoal Organisation (ICCO) meeting.

The ICCO and other traders have estimated Malaysia's 1995/96 output at between 105,000 and 110,000 tonnes. The delegate attending the ICCO meeting said Malaysia's cocoa production was likely to increase steadily in the next four years as a result of a rehabilitation programme that the government launched to step up cocoa output.
"We...expect to see the production increase to 140,000 tonnes in 1997/98 while in 1998/99 we see cocoa crop production at 150,000 tonnes," he said.
